titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Department of Comparative Literature RG.21.50
titlestmt.author: Stacey Flatt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:43:09 -0400.

did.unittitle: Records of the Department of Comparative Literature

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Department of Comparative Literature.

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: New York University. Department of Comparative Literature.

did.abstract: The NYU Department of Comparative Literature's curriculum is aimed at students with broad interdisciplinary interests, a desire to explore new fields and forms of experimental thinking, and diverse language backgrounds. This collection contains issues of the Department's undergraduate literary journal, Brio and graduate literary journal, Barricade, dating from 2010 to 2019.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Department of Comparative Literature transferred material in July 2019; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2019.083.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The NYU Department of Comparative Literature engages students with broad interdisciplinary interests and a desire to explore new fields and forms of experimental thinking. Seminar-format courses are offered with intensive faculty interaction and discussion. Faculty specializations include European, Anglo-American, African, Slavic, Latin American, Caribbean, Chinese, South Asian, and Middle Eastern literatures. Departmental courses immerse students in ancient, early modern, and modern global literatures, often with an emphasis on Continental philosophy and literary and critical theory more generally.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Records of the Department of Comparative Literature; RG 21.50; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, material was housed in acid-free folders and box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues of the New York University Department of Comparative Literature undergraduate literary publication, Brio and graduate literary journal, Barricade, dating from 2010 to 2019.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.
